name: Science Variety Questions Trivia Game | Miscellaneous Science | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is another term for salivary amylase?
questions.explanation:
Ptyalin.

	Ptyalin, or salivary amylase, begins the digestion process of starches.

questions.text: An 'epiphyte' describes a plant with which of the following characteristics?
options: Growth on rocks or other mineral substances
questions.explanation:
Non-parasitic growth on other plants.

	Epiphytes include mosses and lichens, among others.

questions.text: For which type of scientist would a Hertzsprung-Russell diagram be of use?
questions.explanation:
Astronomer.

	An H-R diagram graphically represents stars plotted with the absolute magnitude on the y-axis and the spectral class on the x-axis.

questions.text: Which elementary particle is the exchange particle for the gravitational force?
What is the term for an unsaturated hydrocarbon with at least one double carbon-carbon bond?
Which Italian philosopher was likely the first Western person to state in writing that the universe is infinite?
questions.explanation:
Giordano Bruno.

	I think they've been saying this in India all along, haven't they?

questions.text: Which compound appears to be two benzene rings linked side by side?
questions.explanation:
Naphthalene.

	Naphthalene is an aromatic hydrocarbon that smells like mothballs (it was formerly added to mothcakes, prior to the widespread use of paradichlorobenzene).

questions.text: What's the scientific name for the nostrils?
Which of the following individuals was involved in the discovery of the most chemical elements?
questions.explanation:
Ghiorso.

	Ghiorso was involved (with teams) in the discovery of 10 different elements. They are, in alphabetical order: Berkelium, Curium, Einsteinium, Fermium, Hahnium, Lawrencium, Mendelevium, Nobelium, Rutherfordium, and Seaborgium. If you'll notice, all but one of these elements is named for great scientists.
